item.title: US seizes $61M in USDT linked to ‚Äòpig butchering‚Äô crypto fraud scheme
item.description: The $61 million USDT seizure in North Carolina shows how US authorities can trace and freeze stablecoin flows tied to pig butchering scams, as AI‚Äëdriven impersonation schemes surge.

item.title: Bitcoin ETFs post $258M inflows as institutional Q4 selling hits 25,000 BTC
item.description: US spot Bitcoin ETF flows turned green on Tuesday, with Fidelity and BlackRock leading gains despite persistent weak market sentiment.

item.title: Leading stablecoin Tether shrinks again as market cap looks set for second straight monthly drop
item.description: Growth of tether and other top stablecoins has stalled, posing risk to the broader crypto market.

item.title: Hong Kong to link new digital bond platform with regional tokenization hubs
item.description: Hong Kong will build a digital asset platform for tokenized bond issuance and settlement, while moving ahead with stablecoin licensing and CARF.

item.title: Vitalik Buterin sold 17,000 ETH this month as ether fell 37%
item.description: The Ethereum co-founder's tracked wallets dropped from 241,000 ETH to 224,000 ETH in February, with sales routed through CoW Protocol in small batches to limit market impact.

item.title: Crypto firm with U.S. bank charter holds bitcoin holder Strategy's preferred stock
item.description: Anchorage Digital, the first federally chartered U.S. crypto bank, has added perpetual preferred stock in bitcoin treasury firm Strategy to its balance sheet.

item.title: Dogecoin jumps 5% as breakout flips resistance into support
item.description: The token is consolidating around $0.0940‚Äì$0.0945 with higher lows, signaling constructive momentum after the breakout.

item.title: Bitcoin adoption is booming, even if its price isn‚Äôt: River
item.description: River reports that Bitcoin adoption surged in 2025, cementing it as a mature asset class, even as its price has halved since hitting a peak in October.

item.title: Coinbase CEO Pushes Back on UK Stablecoin Caps as Token Profits Surge
item.description: The proposal would cap stablecoin holdings and curb yields, a move critics say could push liquidity overseas as stablecoins become a core revenue stream.

item.title: South Korean man indicted in alleged pesticide poisoning tied to crypto losses
item.description: South Korean prosecutors reportedly accused a man of poisoning a business partner with pesticide in a dispute over losses due to crypto trading.

item.title: Bitcoin bounces above $65,000 as dollar weakens and bullish hopes build
item.description: A broad uptick across tokens arrived alongside a softer greenback and a rally in Asian equities, though analysts remain split on whether the Feb. 5 lows will hold.

item.title: Bitcoin Ticks Higher as Markets Weigh Trump Address, Broader Risk Sentiment
item.description: Bitcoin remains sensitive to broader risk sentiment, with traders positioning ahead of Nvidia‚Äôs earnings and a rebound in global stocks.

item.title: Bitcoin captures $65K after US stocks rebound from AI sell-off: Will it hold?
item.description: Bitcoin rallied above $66,000 following a positive close from US stock markets, putting Monday‚Äôs AI and tech-stock driven sell-off to rest. Will $60,000 remain the BTC bottom?

item.title: Payoneer joins rush of fintechs bidding for US bank charters
item.description: Coinbase, World Liberty Financial and Laser Digital are also in line for a banking charter in the US, after Crypto.com received conditional approval for a charter on Monday.

item.title: Stripe considers acquiring some or all of PayPal: Report
item.description: Bloomberg reports that Stripe is in early acquisition talks with PayPal as the payments giant has battled competition, leadership turmoil and an 85% stock drop from its peak.

item.title: Stripe in Early Talks on Potential PayPal Deal: Bloomberg
item.description: The deal could combine two major payments firms already expanding into stablecoin and crypto infrastructure.

item.title: Crypto lobby Blockchain Association pitches tax plan to Congress
item.description: The Blockchain Association urged Congress to exempt low-dollar crypto transactions and tax mining and staking rewards upon sale.

item.title: Anthropic says it's been targeted in massive distillation attacks
item.description: Anthropic alleges Chinese AI companies DeepSeek, Moonshot and MiniMax made 24,000 accounts and 16 million Claude exchanges to scrape its AI bot for training.

item.title: Bitwise acquires Chorus One, potentially paving way for more staked ETFs
item.description: Bitwise‚Äôs acquisition of Chorus One expands the company‚Äôs staking capabilities to more than 30 blockchains, including Solana, Hyperliquid, Monad, Avalanche and Sui.

item.title: Treasury Sanctions Russian ‚ÄòExploit‚Äô Broker Over Stolen US Cyber Tools
item.description: It marks the first use of the Protecting American Intellectual Property Act, targeting a firm accused of brokering stolen U.S. cyber tools.

item.title: Coinbase, Kraken and Binance Push Deeper Into Tokenization as Capital Shifts
item.description: Tokenized real-world assets have continued to expand despite a broader market slide, with assets distributed on-chain up nearly 300% year over year.

item.title: ETH options turn bearish as traders prepare for extended Ether price downside
item.description: Ether faces a bearish trend as onchain fees and network deposits hit multiyear lows. Until derivatives metrics stabilize, ETH price remains at risk.

item.title: Bitcoin Depot Will Require ID for 'Every Transaction' at ATMs Amid Growing Pressure
item.description: Bitcoin Depot will begin verifying customers‚Äô identities each time they use its ATMs, voluntarily refining its compliance procedures.

item.title: ESMA warns crypto perpetual derivatives likely fall under CFD rules
item.description: The EU authority tracking compliance under the MiCA framework issued a warning to those marketing crypto derivatives as ‚Äúperpetual futures or perpetual contracts.‚Äù

item.title: Crypto wallets for AI agents are creating a new legal frontier, says Electric Capital
item.description: As AI agents grow more autonomous, developers are already giving them crypto wallets, allowing software to hold assets, pay for services, trade tokens and even hire other agents. The technical pieces are falling into place. The legal ones ‚Ä¶

item.title: Payments giant Stripe reportedly mulling PayPal acquisition. Here is what it means for crypto
item.description: Bloomberg reported that Stripe ‚Äî which has growing stablecoin and blockchain ambitions ‚Äî is exploring a deal for the embattled fintech.

item.title: Coinbase opens stock and ETF trading to all US users in multi-asset push
item.description: The exchange now allows US customers to trade thousands of stocks and ETFs commission-free alongside crypto, with 24/5 access and instant funding.

item.title: Kraken debuts tokenized stock perpetual futures for non-US traders
item.description: Kraken‚Äôs new contracts, built on the xStocks framework, offer up to 20x leverage on tokenized benchmarks tied to US equities and gold.

item.description: MoonPay debuts infrastructure enabling AI agents to transact with stablecoins onchain as both crypto and non-crypto companies race to build the ‚Äúagent economy.‚Äù

item.title: OpenAI Says Benchmark Used to Measure AI Coding Skill Is 'Contaminated'‚ÄîHere's Why
item.description: OpenAI wants to retire the leading AI coding benchmark‚Äîand the reasons reveal a deeper problem with how the whole industry measures itself.

item.title: Bitwise's Hunter Horsley says AI Is ‚Äòunstoppable freight train‚Äô for crypto, while Haun‚Äôs Monica urges caution
item.description: As artificial intelligence races ahead, some crypto executives believe it could become the force that finally pushes blockchain infrastructure into widespread use. Others aren‚Äôt convinced the leap is so straightforward.

item.title: 'Stablecoin Summer': Stripe Makes Tender Offer at $159 Billion Valuation
item.description: Payments giant Stripe made a tender offer valuing the firm at $159 billion as payments and stablecoin volumes rise.

item.title: After Donating $35 Million to Trump PAC, Crypto.com Scores Wins From Regulators
item.description: Weeks after giving another $5 million to a pro-Trump PAC, the exchange received lawsuit aid from the CFTC and a bank charter from the Treasury Department.

item.title: South Korean Man Faces Murder Charge Over Bitcoin Bet Gone Bad
item.description: Prosecutors in Seoul say a man poisoned his business partner after the colleague mismanaged his Bitcoin investments.

item.title: Crypto isn't losing to AI, its just 'capitalism doing its job,' says Dragonfly
item.description: Comparisons between AI‚Äôs explosive consumer adoption and crypto‚Äôs trajectory misunderstand the nature of the products, Dragonfly's Haseeb Qureshi told CoinDesk in an interview.

item.title: Crypto‚Äôs biggest exchange fights back against allegations of moving billions of Iran-linked money
item.description: The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times and Fortune all reported that investigators had been let go after identifying sanctions-violating transactions.

item.title: Key Bitcoin onchain signal may mark BTC‚Äôs next demand revival
item.description: Bitcoin remains pinned below $65,000 as random bouts of intense selling pressure persist, but one onchain indicator has stabilized, providing insight into when spot market demand may return.

item.title: Polymarket users favor Meteora in bets over ZachXBT crypto takedown
item.description: Users placed more than $7 million betting on the outcome of the crypto sleuth's investigation, expected to be announced on Thursday.

item.title: Millions in crypto funded tools to exploit U.S. software, Treasury says in new sanctions
item.description: An Australian national was said to sell cyber tools designed for the U.S. government and its allies to a Russian company known as Operation Zero.

item.title: Longest Ether dip since 2022 ignored by whales: What‚Äôs next for ETH?
item.description: Ether whale order sizes are shrinking, while a $2 billion short cluster near $2,000 frame a tightening liquidity scenario for ETH after a sixth week of red price action.

item.title: Fed proposes rule to deal with crypto debanking by scrapping 'reputation risk'
item.description: The proposal would cut the risk factor from Fed oversight and bar supervisors from pushing banks to cut off disfavored businesses, including in crypto.

item.title: Prediction market firms could be making $10 billion in yearly revenue by 2030, Citizens Bank says
item.description: The bank said rising volumes, tighter market structure and early institutional engagement are pushing prediction markets beyond their gambling roots toward a new asset class.
